title: Arabic Alchemy & Astral Magic
description: The foundational Arabic alchemical corpus including Jabir ibn Hayyan, the Picatrix grimoire of astral magic, and the Herat alchemical compendium. These texts transmitted ancient Near Eastern and Hellenistic knowledge to medieval Europe.
keyWorks: Jabir Corpus: Foundational Arabic alchemy, transmitted to Latin West as 'Geber'
Picatrix: The most influential grimoire of astral magic in Western tradition
Herat Compendium: 15th century synthesis of Islamic alchemical knowledge
researchValue: Essential for understanding the transmission of alchemical knowledge from the Islamic world to medieval and Renaissance Europe. Picatrix was foundational for Renaissance magic (Ficino, Agrippa).
